poem:
Beyond the Uber Door

In the rhythm of wheels,  
I move past rehearsed days;  
life, a pirouette once-danced  
in shadows of stage lights.

Love's quiet entrance,  
when the door opened  
to a world softer  
than pursuit—where  
hearts learn to rest,  
finding grace  
in the unmeasured  
cadence of being.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The moment I knew: as he opened the Uber door, he opened my eyes to a love beyond work In high school I was in an all-consuming relationship with one thing: dance. Any free time I had was spent on working towards a coveted spot at a performance company. As soon as I graduated school in Brisbane, I left to begin my career as a performer. After moving around the world for work, I landed". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
